author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: all that comes late cannot help when emergency occurs
interpretation: this proverb advises that an issue should be solved using measures available at the moment. we should not wait for solutions which can only be obtained later. it may be too late

translations.proverb: Yote yanayokuja baadaye hayawezi kusaidia wakati wa dharura
Tous ceux qui viennent en retard ne peuvent pas aider au cas d’urgence

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: your father is your boss and you need to respect him
interpretation: it teaches that elders and parents must be respected in order for one to have a fruitful life without problems of being accepted in society. their wisdom should be heeded

translations.proverb: Baba yako ni bosi/mtawala wako kwa hivyo unafaa umuheshimu
Ton pere est ton patron, il faut lui respecter

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: to come first or to come late, all are the same
interpretation: it teaches that although a person may start off to pursue an endeavour earlier than another, he/she may not achieve the goal first. what is most important in life is to focus on what we wish to achieve, do it at our own pace and not compete with others

translations.proverb: Kuja mwanzo au kuchelewa, zote ni sawa
Etre en temps ou en retard, c’est la meme chose

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you are searching for something and you don`t get it, forget about it
interpretation: this proverb encourages people not to remain stagnant in one venture or opinion, even when it is not working out. when a person is fixated, his/her does not envision other opportunities for success. a person should be flexible in order to be more successful

translations.proverb: Unapo kitafuta kitu na ukikose, kisahau
Lorsque tu churches une chose et tu ne la trouves pas, oublie-la

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: he who runs after good fortune runs away from peace

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a man`s idea is so powerful that it can move a mountain
interpretation: this proverb encourages us not to doubt ourselves, or what we think we can do. having faith helps a person to achieve the impossible. one may not have resources or skills to do great things, but knowledge and faith can lead one to success

translations.proverb: Wazo la mtu lina nguvu inayoweza kuusongesha mlima
La pense d’une personne a une force qui peut deplacer une montagne

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: our days are very short so we should make good use of them
interpretation: it teaches that human life is not permanent, and we should use the time we have appropriately to benefit the community. people should live a meaningful life and ensure we have a positive impact on those around us

translations.proverb: Siku zetu ni fupi kwa hivyo tunafaa tuzitumia vyema
Nos jours sont tellement court, il nous faut bien les utiliser

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a bird that flies off the earth and lands on an anthill is still on the ground

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you don`t live in unity even your ideas will be different
interpretation: it encourages cohesion within a family or community. when people differ in opinions and ideas, they are bound to have problems with each other. unity among members of a family or community helps them to have related ideas which benefit them all

translations.proverb: Msipoishi kwa umoja, hata mawazo yenu hutofautiana
Si tu ne vis pas en unite meme tes idees seront differentes

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: an intelligent enemy is better than a stupid friend

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: it is not a must you do wrong because you have seen someone do it
interpretation: the proverb teaches that it is important to understand that only benefitial behaviours are worth adopting. people get negatively influenced in behavior and character by the bad people they associate with in their daily life. one has to be careful

translations.proverb: Sio lazima ufanye maovu kwa vile umeona mwingine akiyatenda
Ce n’est obligatoire de faire du mal puisque tu as vu quelqu’un d’autre le fait

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: one who bathes willingly with cold water doesn’t feel the cold

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when the lion gets old even flies attack him

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a flea can trouble a lion more than a lion can trouble a flea

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a man who loves sleep has nothing to benefit from
interpretation: it warns that idleness and laziness does not build one’s progress. a person has to work hard in order to fend for himself and others, and also to gain favour with other people. a lazy or idle person has no associates and cannot prosper

translations.proverb: Mtu anayeupenda usingizi hana cha kumfaidi
Un homme qui aime dormir n’a rien comme benefice

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: who wakes and rises at the first cry of the songbird collects the best fruit of the night

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you must attend to your business with the vendor in the market, and not to the noise of the market

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you cannot decide something alone while leading majority, but it has to be decided and agreed upon by the majority
interpretation: it teaches us the importance of consultation in decision making. it is important to seek opinions from other people so that you make appropriate decisions which benefits everyone

translations.proverb: Huwezi kukubali jambo peke yako ukiwa unaongoza wengine, kwani lazima wengi kati yao wakubaliane
Tu ne peux pas decider une affaire seul autant que vous etes nombreux, seulement il faut que ca soit decide en consentir de tout le monde

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: if you carry the egg basket do not dance

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when the shepherd comes home in peace, the milk is sweet

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: wind makes more noise among the trees

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the leopard's skin is beautiful, but his heart evil

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a deaf ear is followed by death, and an ear that listens is followed by blessings
interpretation: this proverb is used to warn people to be obedient, take advice or face the consequences, which are usually negative. a person who heeds to good advice and instructions grows in wisdom and is acceptable in society. many positive benefits are enjoyed by such a person

translations.proverb: Sikio kiziwi hufuatwa na kifo, na sikio lisikialo hufuatwa na baraka
Un sourd entend qu’il est poursuivi par la mort et l’oreille qui entendais, est poursuivi par la benedictiction

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: there is no shortcut in life
interpretation: it teaches that one has to work very hard and tirelessly to earn a living by whatever means. prosperity comes with hard work

translations.proverb: Hakuna njia ya mkato maishani
Pas de raccourci dans la vie

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: it is better to have no law than not enforcing it

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a bad person cannot be hidden by his/her bad behaviours
interpretation: the proverb warns that a person’s bad behaviour makes the members of a community not want to associate him/her. this is because they fear being influenced by the person, or judged by the community as having the same behavior. we should therefore, choose suitable associates who build us and not destroy us

translations.proverb: Mtu mbaya hawezi kufichwa na tabia zake
Un mauvais homme ne peut pas cacher son comportement

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: where water is the boss, there the land must obey

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: never count on what you don’t have

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don’t judge somebody without understanding him/her
interpretation: it is used as a warning to those who judge others by their physical appearance or first encounter impressions. each person has greater value and abilities than what we externally see. every person has inner values which are more important than our physical looks

translations.proverb: Usihukumu mtu bila kumuelewa
Ne juge pas une personne avant que tu ne l’entends pas

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the child you sired hasn’t sired you

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don’t count your chicks before they hatch
interpretation: place your expectations on what you have with you, and not on what you hope to get in the future. this is because it may not materialize

translations.proverb: Usihesabu vifaranga wako kama mayai hayajatamia
Ne compte pas tes poussins avant qu’ils trament

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you are making decisions think of how you will benefit from your ideas
interpretation: this proverb teaches that when we make decisions we should consider what effects they will have upon us and other people also

translations.proverb: Unapoamua jambo fikiria vile utafaidika na maono yako
Quand tu decides pense comment elle tes idees beneficieront

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you may not know the extent of another’s suffering until you have the same experience
interpretation: it teaches that someone cannot understand the real bad situation or difficulties that someone is going through unless you are in that state yourself. we may try to encourage a person with tribulations, but we may not fully solve the problems

translations.proverb: Huwezi kuelewa na mateso ya mtu mwingine mpaka uyapitie mwenyewe
C’est difficile de savoir le fond de quelqu’un qui souffre, jusqu’a ce que tu seras dans la meme situation

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: if you do not have patience you cannot make beer

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the owner of the house knows where his roof leak

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you cannot name a child that is not born

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a disobedient person may learn his lessons after being disciplined
interpretation: this proverb teaches that there are consequences of wrong doing. there must be punishment which helps wrong doer to change positively and realize their mistakes. not taking action against a wrong doer encourages continuity of these bad actions

translations.proverb: Mtu mtukutu husoma baada ya kuadhibiwa
Une personne desobeissante save apres etre punie

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: even as the archer loves the arrow that flies, so too he loves the bow that remains constant in his hands

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don’t just move from one place to another without seeing
interpretation: the nomadic lifestyle of the samburu community requires that before they move to new fields to herd their livestock, they ensure it is safe. the proverb teaches that we should plan, be alert and ready to face consequences. a person should always focus ahead, be prepared and decisive in order to succeed in achieving an intended goal

translations.proverb: Usishinde kuhama bila kuona unakoenda
Ne te deplaces pas d’une place a l’autre sans savoir quoi y faire

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: if your only tool is a hammer, you will see every problem as a nail

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a child is a child of everyone

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: members of the same family are open to each other and can discuss anything
interpretation: this proverb teaches the importance of bonding and trust in a family. family members should communicate with each other so that they can help each other. they should not hide issues from each other. they should be a team

translations.proverb: Watu wa jamii moja hawafichani mambo na hujadiliana juu ya lolote
Les membres de meme famille sont ouvert,l’un a l’autre et peuvent discuter n’importe quoi

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: an orphaned calf licks its own back

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you cannot build a house for last year’s summer

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: slander by the stream will be heard by the frogs

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a person cannot abandon his family and walk alone, he must return
interpretation: it teaches that family is of great value to society. a person always needs to be part of a family circle. even if you segregate yourself, a time comes when one needsthem. family will support someone, whether they are good or bad. blood is thicker than water. family bonds are very important to everyone

translations.proverb: Mtu hawezi kuacha jamii yake na kutembea peke yake; lazima arudi
N’abandone pas ta famille et va seule, tu dois retourner

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when someone does good to you, you should do the same to them
interpretation: it teaches the need to treat people well, if we expect to be treated the same by others. never despise anyone because of their status, race, age or any other reason. we may need them later in life and they may not be ready to treat you well

translations.proverb: Mtu akikutendea memo, unafaa umtendee hivyo pia
Ne rends pas le mal pour mal

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a child that has his father is better than an orphan because he get advices from his father
interpretation: this proverb teaches us the importance of appreciating what we have, because when you lose, it that is when you realize it is valuable in your life. support from other members of the community or family is essential. at some time, everyone requires someone/people to lean on in life

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: people reason differently
interpretation: this proverb teaches us that every person is unique and has different abilities as created by god. for instance, in a community people have different views, opinion, knowledge which can be used positively to benefit others.

translations.proverb: Watu huelewa mambo kwa njia zinazotofautiana
Les gens pensent toujours differement

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a young person can have an idea that can help even the elderly
interpretation: it teaches that a young person can have wisdom, abilities and ideas which can benefit the elderly. it is not only our elders who can guide and lead. in the society, even young people should be given an opportunity to implement their ideas to help community

translations.proverb: Kijana anaweza kuwa na wazo ambalo linaweza kusaidia mzee
U n jeune peut avoir une idee qui peut aider un vieux

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the tracks of the elephant cancels those of the antelope

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: war is not good for anyone
interpretation: this proverb is used to emphasize the importance of peaceful co-existence and brotherhood. in case of disagreement, calm and favourable solutions should be sort in order not to aggravate a situation

translations.proverb: Vita si vyema kwa yeyote
La guerre n’est bonne a personne

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the child of a rat is a rat

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you know how to speak, but you don’t know how you can be told
interpretation: it advises that a person should listen to other people, allow others to present their views and opinions. views from one person may not be helpful to all. listen to the wisdom of others too

translations.proverb: Unajua kuongea, lakini hujui vile unaweza kuambiwa
Tu sais comment parler mais tu ne sais pas comment on peut te dire

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when your finger is in pain, your sight is not lazy

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: strong person can be defeated by a weak person
interpretation: it teaches that a physically strong person may be weak in wisdom. a person may be undermined by others because he does not seem able especially economically. however, this person may have the strength of the mind, much wisdom and good decision making abilities, which are more valuable than physical strength

translations.proverb: Mwenye nguvu anaweza kushindwa na mtu mdhaifu
Un homme fort peut etre battu par inapte

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when an elephant combats, it is the grass that suffers

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a spider’s cobweb isn’t only its sleeping spring but also its food trap

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: even the best cooking pot will not produce food

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: those who respect the elderly pave their own road toward success

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don`t do something that you have no idea about
interpretation: being ignorant is unwise. a person should not deal with matters which they have no knowledge about because they will make mistakes which may harm others or themselves. don’t be a know- it-all. it is safest to leave issues to be handled by those who know how to

translations.proverb: Usilifanye jambo ambalo haulielewi
Ne fais pas une que tu n’as pas idee

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: be a mountain or lean on one

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: it is crooked wood that shows the best sculptor

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: better little than too little

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you go to bed at night have tomorrow’s plan with you
interpretation: this proverb helps us to learn the importance of planning early to avoid last minute arrangements. a person ensures there are no omissions and errors which can cause inconveniences

translations.proverb: Unapoenda kulala usiku kuwa na mpango wa kesho
Quand tu vas au lit la nuit,ait le plan de demain

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: he that beats the drum for the mad man to dance is no better than the mad man himself

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you are discussing something important, it needs time
interpretation: this proverb teaches us that for anything to be achieved it takes sacrifices in terms of time and patience to make it succeed

translations.proverb: Unapo jadilia jambo la muhimu, inahitaji muda
Quand tu discutes une chose importante, il faut temps

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the death of an elderly man is like a burning library

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a camel does not joke about the hump of another camel

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: if you are poor now, it doesn’t mean that you will remain poor forever
interpretation: the circumstances of today do not reflect on those of your future. the situation may be completely different. we should therefore, have hope for better days to come and work towards making these positive changes

translations.proverb: Ukiwa maskini sasa sio kumaanisha utabaki maskini milele
Si tu es pauvre aujourd’hui, ne signifie pas que tu le seras eternellement

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: never count on what you don’t have until you have it
interpretation: it teaches that a person should not anticipate things to happen the way he/she wishes. the outcome may not be as had been planned. one should plan keeping in mind what resources they have at hand

translations.proverb: Usitarajie kitu ambacho haujakipata, mpaka ukipate
Ne comptes pas sur ce que tu n’as pas jusqu’a ce que tu le trouveras

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: something that you have doubted you will continue doing
interpretation: this proverb teaches us to be persistent in what we do in order to succeed in an endeavor. practice makes perfect. even when one is unsure of their ability to make correct decisions or perform good work, they may find themselves excelling as a result of making extra effort

translations.proverb: Jambo ambalo hauna uhakika nalo utaendelea kulifanya
Si tu doutes sur quelque chose aujourd’hui, ceci continuera

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: no one can prove himself wrong
interpretation: no one is ever perfect. we need others to help us grow and gain knowledge. a person cannot know their real weaknesses until another person points them out. we should accept to be corrected by others

translations.proverb: Hakuna mtu ambaye anaweza kujikosoa
Personne peut dire ses propres malfaisance

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: earth is the queen of beds

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: those who work together can`t see each other.
interpretation: it teaches that people in a team should not wait for the other member to do something, but each one should play their part without being forced. for instance, a person should not wait to be told to help out a family member, but should do it by choice and as an obligation. we should not wait for another member to help out

translations.proverb: Wanaofanya kazi pamoja hawaonani
Ceux qui travillent ensemble ne se voient pas

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don`t mess with your tongue
interpretation: this proverb is used to warn people not to damage themselves by what they speak – or cause other people anguish and misery. a person should think twice before expressing their thoughts

translations.proverb: Usiharibu kwa ulimi
Ne salis pas par la langue

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: good actions are nourishment for youths, much more than words

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: even a poor person has his day
interpretation: it teaches that there are always opportunities that bring good benefits to people, especially when they least expect it. chances come to people in different times and varied ways. we should appreciate when this happens to us

translations.proverb: Hata masikini ana siku yake
Meme une personne pauvre a son jour a se rejouir

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: no one will see his own behaviours
interpretation: it teaches that nobody is able to realize their weaknesses and mistakes. everyone thinks they are perfect. other people see our weaknesses and correct us so that we can change for the better. we should accept correction always

translations.proverb: Hakuna yeyote anayeona tabia zake
Aucne personne peut voir son comportement

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: if you pick up one end of the stick you also pick up the other

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: he who is unable to dance says that the yard is stony

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the first person will get first things
interpretation: it teaches that a person who begins doing things before others succeeds earlier. one’s idea should be implemented before other people steal it. this makes you achieve your intentions with greater success

translations.proverb: Mtu wa kwanza hupata vitu vya kwanza
C’est le premier d’arriver qui boit l’eau la plus pure

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when a person continuously does wrong he/she cannot realize until they are told
interpretation: a person does not know when making constant mistakes in their daily lives. members of the community see those mistakes and tell the person. this provides opportunity for change of behaviours. we should accept correction from others who mean well, and not assume we are always correct

translations.proverb: Mtu anaye fanya makosa kila wakati hawezi kutambua huyafanya mpaka aambiwe
Il est difficile pour un malfaiteur de savoir ce qu’il fait jusqu’a ce que il sera informe

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when the webs of the spider join, they can trap a lion

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don`t beat somebody to death. punish them for the wrong they have done
interpretation: an offender must be ready to face the consequences. the person should be made to learn from their mistakes. killing an offender does not help others to learn from his/her mistakes. punishment helps others to learn so that they also correct their ways

translations.proverb: Usichape mtu mpaka umuue. Muadhibu kwa makosa aliyoyafanya
Ne bat pas quelqu’un pour lui tuer, mais punisse-lui pour les fautes qu’il commit

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: birds sing not because they have answers but because they have songs

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: lack of remembering is a problem
interpretation: this proverb teaches that a person should not forget past experiences, so that someone will not repeat the same mistakes. history is the best teacher. we should recall the past and make better decisions today and in future

translations.proverb: Kukosa kukumbuka ni shida
Ne pas se rappeler, c’est un probleme

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: there is no hiding place on the water surface

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a home without a mother is a desert

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: people cannot have a meeting while standing, but when they are seated
interpretation: this proverb teaches that important matters should be handled carefully and without a hurry. people should consult carefully and in depth without getting impatient, until a proper decision is made about the issue

translations.proverb: Watu hawawezi kuendeleza mkutano wakiwa wamesimama, lakini wawe wameketi
Les gens ne peuvent pas avoir une reunion en etant debout, il faut qu’ils soient assis

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a doctor who invoked a storm on his people cannot prevent his house from destruction

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: remember, after the storm there will be a rainbow

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don`t accept mistakes that you have not done
interpretation: it teaches that a person must take responsibility for their deeds, but should not accept responsibility for wrong deeds they did not do. we should always stand by the truth that we know

translations.proverb: Usikubali makosa ambayo hujayafanya
Nacceptes pas les fautes que tu n’as pas fait

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: teeth do not see poverty

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: no matter how beautiful and well-crafted a coffin might look, it will not make anyone wish for death

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when somebody gets rich, you should not ask where he obtained his wealth
interpretation: it teaches that a prosperous person acquires his wealth through his own efforts and hard work. it encourages people to work hard to achieve their comforts and good opportunities, in their own ways, instead of interfering with other people’s ventures

translations.proverb: Mtu anapo tajirika, usimuulize aliipata wapi au vipi mali yake
Lorsqu’une personne devient riche,il ne faut pas demander d’ou lui vienne cette richesse

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don`t laugh at somebody who is suffering. you should help him
interpretation: this proverb teaches us the importance of being our brother’s keeper. in a community or family, it is essential that we be concerned with each other’s problems and needs. help others when they need help, according to your ability. you will require help sometime also

translations.proverb: Usichekelee mtu anaye teseka. Unafaa umsaidie
Ne dedaigne pas quelqu’un qui manque, seulement il faut lui aider

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: anger and madness are brothers

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: if you are building a house and a nail breaks, do you stop building or do you change the nail?

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: knowledge is like owning property
interpretation: it teaches that a person’s knowledge is of great value; as much value as any wealth one may have. if one puts knowledge to good use, it can help to gain economical, social and financial stability in life

translations.proverb: Kuwa na ujuzi ni sawa na kuwa na mali
La connaissance est comme avoir des biens materiels

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when the roots of a tree begin to decay, it spreads death to the branches

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: your best friend can turn out to be your worst enemy
interpretation: this proverb teaches that a person should be careful with the choice of friends they make because not all friends are genuine. some work towards ensuring you fail in yous endeavors, instead of supporting you to succeed. do not be over-trusting

translations.proverb: Rafiki wa dhati anaweza kugeuka kuwa adui mbaya
Ton vrai ami peut changer et etre ton ennemi jure

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: two men who have a family cannot live together in the same house
interpretation: this proverb teaches that people with different characters, visions and opinions may not usually agree with each other. they may differ in opinion but both may be of benefit to each other. we should therefore, accommodate each other in society/family and respect each other’s opinions

translations.proverb: Wanaume wawili walio na jamii hawawezi kuishi katika nyumba moja
Deux hommes qui ont des familles ne peuvent pas vivre dans une meme maison

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: nobody makes others to be rich
interpretation: this proverb is used to encourage people to work hard because nothing comes for free. personal effort makes a person become independent and able to support themselves economically

translations.proverb: Hakuna yeyote ambaye hufanya wengine kuwa tajiri
Personne peut enrichir quelqu’un d’autre

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you cannot be satisfied by your own things but you have to keep on searching
interpretation: it teaches us that people are never satisfied with what they have acquired. they continue generating more wealth. this can lead to greed and problematic encounters and loss of morals. people should have comforts but not in excess.

translations.proverb: Huwezi kutosheka na vitu vyako pekee, lakini utaendelea kutafuta
Tu ne peux pas etre sastifait par tes biens mais il faut continuer a chercher

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: don’t bite the hand that feeds you.
interpretation: it teaches the importance of appreciating any good deeds done to us by others. we should respect, honour and protect those who support us in our lives because when they are not able we shall surely suffer

translations.proverb: Usiuume mkono unaokulisha
Ne piques pas la main qui te sert a manger

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you don’t listen to elders you will destroy your life
interpretation: it warns about disobedience to authority and elders. when a person defies society norms, then other people disassociate with him/her. one loses respect, trust and is not accepted in the community or family. life becomes difficult because nobody is willing to assist them when in need

translations.proverb: Usipowasikiza wazee utayaharibu maisho yako
Si tu n’ecoutes les vieux-ages, tu risques ta vie

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: even the lion, the king of the forest, protects himself against flies

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you should keep secrets of your family and also yours
interpretation: it teaches that family issues should not be told to outsiders. keep private issues between those concerned with them, because it can destroy good relationships within the family

translations.proverb: Unafaa kuweka siri za jamii na zako
Il te faut cacher le secret de ta famille

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the wiseman's promises are like dew on the field

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: everyone has his own vision towards life
interpretation: it’s used to help people understand that, everyone should have a purpose in life, so that they focus on it to be able to positively shape their lives. aimless living without a goal one wishes to achieve in life, leads to poverty and unhappiness

translations.proverb: Kila mtu ana maono yake kuhusu maisha
Tout et chacun a sa vision pour la vie

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: where you will sit when you are old shows where you stood in youth

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: he who burns down his house knows why ashes cost a fortune

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the food which is prepared has no master

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you show the moon to a child, it sees only your finger

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: do a good deed and throw it into the sea

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the young bird does not crow until it hears the old ones

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the rain falls on only one roof

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: respect your elder brother, he is a symbol of unity
interpretation: this proverb teaches us the importance of respecting our elders, whether they are blood relatives or not. respect ensures that we get respected by others and be accepted in the community

translations.proverb: Mheshimu ndugu aliye mkubwa wako, yeye ni ishara ya ushirikiano
Respectes ton grand-frere, car il est le symbole de l’unite

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: in a competition there must always be a winner
interpretation: the proverb teaches that when in competition, a person should be prepared to either win or lose. a person should accept the outcome. people should learn not to be selfish and want everything for themselves. they should allow others to have a chance to stand out and feel heroic

translations.proverb: Katika mashindano lazima kuwe na mshindani
Dans une competition il faut qu’il y ait un gagnant

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the worlds of the elders do not lock all the doors; they leave the right door open

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the night has ears

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you get yourself into trouble you have to rescue yourself
interpretation: it teaches that however bad or poorly a situation may be a person can still make the best out of it. bad circumstances can change to good, by a person making effort to change them. one can be poor, but gain wealth by working hard and investing

translations.proverb: Unapo jiingisha kwa shida inabidi ujiokoe mwenyewe
Lorsque tut e trouves dans un problem, il te faut se defender toi-meme

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: we desire to bequeath two things to our children. the first one is roots; the other one is wings

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you should be watchful all the time
interpretation: this proverb teaches that we should be careful about what we do or say because it can lead to many problems. disagreements between family, friends and associates can arise. we should always try not to fall into such situations

translations.proverb: Unafaa ujihadhari kila wakati
Il faut etre guard chaque fois

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: a visitor who does not know where to pass is blind.
interpretation: this proverb encourages consultation with those who have knowledge or skill about certain matters or work. when a person is doing something they are not familiar with, they may do it wrongly or totally fail

translations.proverb: Mgeni asiyejua kwa kupitia ni kipofu
Le visiteur qui ne sait ou passer est aveugle

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you have been overpowered in battle, look for a way to escape

translations.proverb: Unaposhindwa katika vita, tafuta njia ya kutoroka
Lorsqu’on est tellement battu,il faut chercher un chemin pour se proteger

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you should not reveal your secrets to everyone
interpretation: a person should not expose their issues too much to those they view as friends, because some are not genuine friends. they can use this knowledge against them

translations.proverb: Hufai kueleza siri zako kwa kila mtu
Ne devoiles pas tes secrets a tout le monde

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the goat eats the grass where it is tied

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when you befriend a chief, remember that he sits on a rope

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you have little power over what’s not yours

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: you cannot get tired of solving your own problems
interpretation: life cannot be without troubles. this proverb encourages people to solve problems for themselves when they arise. we should not give up even when solutions are slow. we should also not wait for other people to solve them

translations.proverb: Huwezi kuchoka kutatua shida zako
Tu ne dois pas se fatiguer de regler tes problemes

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: elderliness is not a disease, but a richness

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: the suffering of another person cannot affect you, but your own suffering affects you
interpretation: the proverb teaches that a person does not understand the magnitude of another’s difficult situation, until they experience similar tribulations. for instance, we may not be able to be emphathic towards others unless we try to ‘fit in their shoes’

translations.proverb: Mateso ya mtu mwingine hayawezi kukuadhiri, lakini yako mwenyewe yatakuadhiri
La souffrance du quelqu’un ne peut pas t’affecter, seulement la tienne

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: when others have received, you may still receive, because god is always present

author: 63f9d731c2e0f1370aa14110
proverb: if you are a flag follow the wind
